Learn about real-time notifications and: Learn about real-time notifications and email services in MBC CQRS Serverless.
The NotificationModule provides two type: The NotificationModule provides two types of notification capabilities in the MBC CQRS Serverless framework:
**Real-time notifications** via AWS AppS: **Real-time notifications** via AWS AppSync for WebSocket-based updates
**Email notifications** via AWS SES for: **Email notifications** via AWS SES for sending emails
Real-time notifications are automaticall: Real-time notifications are automatically sent when data changes occur in DynamoDB. The system uses AWS AppSync to deliver notifications to subscribed WebSocket clients.
Partition key of the changed item: Partition key of the changed item
Sort key of the changed item: Sort key of the changed item
Creates a NotificationEvent from an SQS: Creates a NotificationEvent from an SQS record
The `AppSyncService` sends real-time not: The `AppSyncService` sends real-time notifications to AppSync for WebSocket delivery.
Sends a notification to AppSync via Grap: Sends a notification to AppSync via GraphQL mutation. The notification is delivered to all subscribed WebSocket clients.
Optional: Use API key auth instead of IA: Optional: Use API key auth instead of IAM
The AppSyncService supports two authenti: The AppSyncService supports two authentication methods:
Used automatically when API key is not s: Used automatically when API key is not set
The framework automatically sends notifi: The framework automatically sends notifications when data changes through:
Handler extracts change information and: Handler extracts change information and creates `INotification`
Connected clients receive updates via We: Connected clients receive updates via WebSocket subscription
The `NotificationEvent` class represents: The `NotificationEvent` class represents a notification event from SQS. It implements `IEvent` and wraps an SQS record containing notification data.
The `NotificationEventHandler` is the bu: The `NotificationEventHandler` is the built-in event handler that processes `NotificationEvent` and sends notifications to AppSync. It is automatically registered when using the notification module.
Parses the notification from event body: Parses the notification from event body
You typically don't need to interact wit: You typically don't need to interact with this handler directly - it works automatically when notifications are published to the SQS queue.
The `EmailService` sends emails using AW: The `EmailService` sends emails using AWS SES.
Sender email (uses SES_FROM_EMAIL if not: Sender email (uses SES_FROM_EMAIL if not set)
The `sendInlineTemplateEmail()` method a: The `sendInlineTemplateEmail()` method allows you to send templated emails with dynamic data substitution, without requiring pre-registered SES templates.
Inline template emails (`sendInlineTempl: Inline template emails (`sendInlineTemplateEmail()`) were added in [version 1.0.23](./changelog#v1023).
Templates use `{{variableName}}` placeho: Templates use `{{variableName}}` placeholders that are replaced with values from the `data` object:
Template with subject, HTML, and optiona: Template with subject, HTML, and optional text
Data object for template variable substi: Data object for template variable substitution
SES configuration set name for tracking: SES configuration set name for tracking
When running locally without SES access,: When running locally without SES access, the method automatically falls back to manual template compilation, allowing you to test email flows during development.
